page.title: 08Special Education in Medway
page.content: The Bligh Tutorial Unit in west Strood caters for 36 children from the Medway area who have learning difficulties. They attend the unit usually for about eighteen months and then are able to return to their original schools. Fulmar School in west Strood is for children with severe learning difficulties (severely mentally handicapped, some of whom are also physically handicapped). Nearly 100 children, aged 5 _ 19, attend, from all over Gravesham, Medway and Gillingham. Many people from the local area give valuable help to the school. The school moved into new purpose-built accommodation in 1984, with very many special facilities for the handicapped. Most children are taught individually, learning to communicate and look after themselves.
